intro: Crotalaria arvensis, commonly known as field cowpea, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its erect or prostrate growth habit and produces clusters of yellow, spurred flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, pod-like structures that mature into a distinctive, spiny form. Crotalaria arvensis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
